input:
5 ways to make money with your AI skills 
- get a job 
- implementation 
- strategy/consulting 
- education
- product
writing_steps:
Step 1:
- Purpose: Educate readers on multiple ways to monetize AI skills (practical frameworks, not just obvious jobs).
- Target audience: People learning AI, AI practitioners, those considering how to monetize technical skills, potential freelancers, and solopreneurs.

Step 2: Wireframe

[Hook: "5 ways to make money with your AI skills (beyond a 9-5 job)"]

[Meat: List and briefly explain each way.]

[CTA: "What would you add to this list?"]


Step 3: Body

If you’re building AI skills, there’s more than one way to get paid. Here are five approaches I’ve seen work:

1) Get a job — Work as an AI/ML engineer, data scientist, or researcher at a company.
2) Implementation services — Build and deliver AI systems as a freelancer or independent contractor.
3) Strategy/consulting — Help teams design architectures, choose tools, or improve their AI projects.
4) Education — Teach AI concepts through online courses, tutorials, or workshops.
5) Product — Build and sell your own AI-powered tool or SaaS app.


Step 4: CTA
What would you add to this list?


Step 5A: Hook Directions
- [Direct list] 5 ways to earn income with AI skills (not just 9-5)
- [Beginner-expert] Most only see “get a job” as the path—here are 4 more
- [Practical breakdown] These are the main income streams I see for AI practitioners today
- [Question format] Are you using your AI skills to earn in more than one way? Here’s a list

Step 5B: Add notes
- [Direct list] Clear, straightforward title
- [Beginner-expert] Tease that list goes beyond obvious
- [Practical breakdown] Emphasize clarity and stepwise thinking
- [Question format] Could frame as a challenge

Step 5C: Pick best hook
The direct, straightforward approach fits Shaw’s style and reinforces the educational value: "5 ways to make money with your AI skills (beyond a 9-5 job)"

Step 6: Draft
5 ways to make money with your AI skills (beyond a 9-5 job)

If you’re learning or working in AI, earning money isn’t limited to employment contracts. Here are five ways I see people monetize their expertise:

1) Full-time role — Join a company as an AI/ML engineer, data scientist, or researcher.
2) Implementation — Build and deploy AI solutions as a freelancer or for clients.
3) Consulting — Advise teams on strategy, architecture, or tool selection for their AI projects.
4) Education — Teach what you know through courses, tutorials, or workshops.
5) Product — Build an AI-powered tool or SaaS app and sell directly to users.

What would you add to this list?

Step 7: Review
- One em dash used (“beyond a 9-5 job”) in hook, fits style.
- No motivational language.
- Hook is direct, factual, not reflective.
- Practical, clear breakdown, numbered format for easy scan.
- CTA is literal and invites technical/practical additions.
- Tone is direct, honest, and clear.
- Matched to Example Posts 1 and 5 for format.

Step 8: Final Post
final_post:
5 ways to make money with your AI skills (beyond a 9-5 job)

If you’re building AI skills, earning isn’t limited to a traditional job. Here are five practical ways to monetize:

1. Full-time role — Work as an AI/ML engineer, data scientist, or researcher.
2. Implementation — Deliver AI projects as a freelancer or independent contractor.
3. Consulting — Advise teams on AI strategy, architecture, or process improvements.
4. Education — Teach AI through courses, tutorials, or workshops.
5. Product — Build and sell your own AI-powered app or SaaS tool.

What would you add to this list?
